description: A bullish continuation pattern with horizontal resistance at the top and rising support at the bottom. Shows accumulation as buyers become more aggressive while resistance holds, typically resolves with upside breakout.

structure: Flat horizontal resistance line at top (at least 2 touches)
Rising trendline support at bottom (at least 2 touches, each higher low)
Minimum 4 touches total between both lines
Forms within uptrend for continuation (can reverse downtrend too)
Pattern duration: 1-3 months on daily, shorter on intraday
Breakout typically occurs in upper 2/3 of triangle
volume: Volume generally decreases during triangle formation
Volume on rallies should exceed volume on pullbacks (buying dominance)
Strong volume spike on breakout above resistance critical
Low volume during consolidation = healthy accumulation
indicators: Price should remain above key moving averages (20/50-day)
RSI staying above 40-50 during pullbacks shows underlying strength
MACD may consolidate but shouldn't cross deeply bearish
Each pullback finding support higher = bullish structure
timeframe: Can appear on any timeframe but needs proper confirmation

invalidation_signals: Price breaks below rising support line (bearish reversal)
Volume increasing during pullbacks vs rallies (distribution)
Triangle lasts too long (>4 months loses validity)
No volume confirmation on breakout (weak breakout often fails)
Forms in strong downtrend with no prior base
common_mistakes: Confusing with symmetrical triangle (which has descending resistance)
Ignoring volume on breakout (no volume = false breakout risk)
Drawing sloped resistance when should be horizontal
Not waiting for close above resistance
Missing the volume pattern (rallies need higher volume)

trade_setup.entry: Enter on break and close above horizontal resistance with volume
trade_setup.stop_loss: Place below most recent higher low on rising support
trade_setup.target: Measure triangle height at widest point, add to breakout level
